alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Hall; Howard; Kearney; Phelps; Sherman (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 05 at 11:42PM CDT until May 06 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Phelps County in south central Nebraska... Northwestern Kearney County in south central Nebraska... Buffalo County in south central Nebraska... Sherman County in central Nebraska... Western Howard County in central Nebraska... Western Hall County in south central Nebraska... * Until 1230 AM CDT. * At 1142 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mason City to 7 miles northwest of Pleasanton to near Elm Creek to 8 miles north of Loomis, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Automated Weather Station. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Pleasanton, Litchfield and Hazard around 1150 PM CDT. Riverdale around 1155 PM CDT. Kearney and Poole around 1200 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Ravenna, Loup City, Rockville, Sherman Reservoir Dam, Gibbon, Ashton, Boelus and Shelton. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 256 and 293. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Buffalo; Hall; Howard; Kearney; Phelps; Sherman
